answers.answer: I was diagnosed with preeclampsia my 1st pregnancy. I wasn't put on bed rest but a few times I had to be monitored at the hopital for a couple of hours bc my pressure would be so high I would be dizzy. Needless to say I made it to 39 weeks they tried induction but didn't work ended up having a c section. I was blessed with a healthy baby boy 7lbs 9oz.

How far along were you when diagnosed? I'm already at 2 cm & 80% effaced as of last week & my doctor said if labor starts she won't stop it. Though if the tests come back she may decide to induce early.

I was diagnosed at 34 weeks. I didn't dialate and no thinning. I rested as much as possible drank lots of water and always had my legs elevated. Try not to stress about it will not help your blood pressure. I'm sure your dr will come up with he best possible plan to keep you and your baby safe. Please keep me posted. I wish u all the best.
Thanks! I'm trying to rest but I have so much on the list of things to do before he gets here its really hard to just sit!

Don't worry your actually already 36 weeks in two weeks you will be 38 I was diagnosed with severe preaclemsia I was so swollen I had all symptoms in my case I had very bad preaclemsia I was hospitalized for two weeks i had my son at 37 weeks pregnant I had a c section and my son was hospitalized for two weeks he had feeding problems and breathing problems it was hard but now he's 5 yrs old and very healthy smart and strong.in your
In your case theirs nothing to worry about just take it easy don't stress or dont eat salt rest alot

In my case even bed rest and eliminating salt did nothing to help me. I bounced back and forth with protein in my urine starting at 35 weeks and had a medically necessary  cs Monday.  I was in bed rest between then and would just pick two small tasks to do each day , one in the morning and then one in the afternoon or evening.  Baby latched on as i was wheeled into recovery and is doing better than the average newborn. No worries mama!
Thanks for the in put. I hope it doesn't come down to a c section, the thought of being cut open..yikes, but I know if it comes down to it we will be ok.

question: I'm 36 weeks & the doctor says I'm showing signs of preclamsia. I've been put on bed rest while tests are being run. Has anyone else had this experience & be willing to share your story? I'm trying not to worry too much at this point but it's hard not to.
title: high blood pressure
